trans-unit.target: TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_SEQ_00<tab>Yugiri has a simple plan for finding Lord Hien.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_TODO_00<tab>Gather information in Reunion.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_TODO_01<tab>Speak with the Goro horsemaster.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_TODO_02<tab>With the chat mode in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Say<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, enter any phrase containing “Mol” to search for a Mol woman.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Cirina.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_LYSE_000_000<tab>Is it just me, or is everyone here Xaela?
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_GOSETSU_000_005<tab>I must confess that this is my first time on the Steppe...
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_YUGIRI_000_010<tab>When last I spoke with Lord Hien, he said he spent much time in these markets. I had hoped we might find him here today, but alas...
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_LYSE_000_011<tab>Hey, Yugiri, I've been meaning to ask─there are an awful lot of Xaela here, aren't there?
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_YUGIRI_000_012<tab>Oh, I assumed you knew. The Azim Steppe has been home to the nomadic tribes of the Xaela since antiquity.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_YUGIRI_000_013<tab>More than fifty roam these lands, and though they do not constitute a nation, there is a hierarchy of sorts, determined through ritual combat.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_LYSE_000_014<tab>Funny... If they're so busy fighting each other, you'd think the Empire would be able to march in and take the Steppe with ease. I wonder why they haven't...
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_GOSETSU_000_015<tab>Why indeed, Lyse? Why indeed...
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_GOSETSU_000_016<tab>Perhaps they see little value in it, especially given the fierce reputation of the Xaela warriors who would fight tooth and nail to oppose them.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_YUGIRI_000_017<tab>These lands were not made for men. The soil is thin, and the weather unforgiving.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_YUGIRI_000_018<tab>The Xaela found ways to survive, it is true. But they are made of sterner stuff than most imperials─conscript or citizen.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_LYSE_000_019<tab>Thanks for taking the time to explain. It sounds like I've got a lot to learn. Later, I mean. We're meant to be looking for Hien!
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_YUGIRI_000_020<tab>People from many tribes gather in Reunion to trade goods and information. I should be surprised if we cannot learn something of value here.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_YUGIRI_000_021<tab>Let us make our inquiries separately. <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, why don't you speak with some of the merchants here?
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_CHAMBUI_000_030<tab>Buuz! Fresh buuz! Your choice of lamb or dzo! Guaranteed to satisfy! How many will you have, <var 08 E905 ((miss)) ((sir)) /var>?
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_CHAMBUI_000_031<tab>Eh? A Doman? Unless another Dazkar is keeping him in her yurt, he is not here. <snort> More fool her if she took a Doman for a husband.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_CHAMBUI_000_032<tab>But enough about Domans─let us speak of buuz instead! You cannot come to the Azim Steppe and not sample this most traditional of delicacies!

TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_CHAMBUI_000_033<tab>But enough about Domans─let us speak of buuz instead! Surely your mother or father made you some when you were little? A Xaela who never eats buuz is never a whole Xaela!
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_CHAMBUI_000_034<tab>You there! Why don't you have a buuz in your hand right now?

TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_YESUI_000_040<tab>What fortune you have to come hither at this time! Freshly slaughtered, every cut available on request. Organs too─hearts, livers, brains. Or a brace of blood sausages, if you desire only a snack!
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_YESUI_000_041<tab>A Doman? Poor meat they make, Domans─ I jest, I jest. Hmm...I did see a young Mol in the company of one some few days ago...
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_YESUI_000_042<tab>Are you sure you do not wish to purchase anything? Organs as fresh as these will be gone before you know it!
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_BAIDUR_000_050<tab>Roasted fish with pumpkin! An exotic foreign delicacy, cooked to perfection, beloved without the Steppe! Come, come!
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_BAIDUR_000_051<tab>You seek Domans? Then you are come to the wrong place, my friend. Delicious as my foodstuffs are, they find little favor with those from the south.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_BAIDUR_000_052<tab>Now, if it were Goro you were looking for, on the other hand, then I might be able to help you. They <var 1A 02 /var>flock<var 1A 01 /var> to my stall!
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_BAIDUR_000_053<tab>Doubtless you know well the wonders of Western cuisine. Then I need not persuade you to partake, yes? Come, come─eat your fill!
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_CIRINA_000_060<tab>I did not think it would be so expensive...
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_NARENGAWA_000_065<tab>There, there. You did well to travel so far.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_UCUGEN_000_070<tab>Where shall we go next?
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_GORO02500_000_080<tab>I have brought you a new brush, my beloved. So smooth and silky your mane shall be─the envy of every other man...
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_GORO02500_000_081<tab>Hm? Say again? You are seeking who?
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_GORO02500_000_082<tab>Ah, the Doman. I know of whom you speak. He comes and goes with a Mol girl.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_GORO02500_000_083<tab>Though I could not describe her. I only know that she is Mol because I heard them talking as they passed.

TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_SYSTEM_000_084<tab>With the chat mode in <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Say<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any phrase that contains “Mol” to ask the Xaela in Reunion if they are of the Mol tribe.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_GORO02500_000_090<tab>Oh, my dearest, how do I love thee? Let me count the ways...
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_NARENGAWA_000_100<tab>I am Ura, if you must know. Come down from the mountains in the north. If there is nothing else...
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_UCUGEN_000_101<tab>You take me for a Mol!? I am Oronir! Compare me not with ones so weak and lowly!
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_CIRINA_000_102<tab>...Yes? I am Mol. My name is Cirina. May I help you?
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_CIRINA_000_110<tab>Oh... Oh, I see. You are looking for Hien. In that case─
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_MASGUD_000_111<tab>How urgent this business must be to leave our conversation unfinished!
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_MASGUD_000_112<tab>The kinsai. Will you buy it? There is but one bundle left. If not, then─
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_CIRINA_000_113<tab>I will, I will! Though I had not thought to pay so high a price...
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_MASGUD_000_114<tab>It is a bargain for which you should be grateful. If you lack the coin, then the fault is your own, and you will leave with nothing.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_CIRINA_000_115<tab>Please, I must have the kinsai! The gods themselves requested it! We are bound to their will!
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_MASGUD_000_116<tab>...Pay me the difference in whisperroot. I will sell it to the next apothecary to pass through Reunion, and we will each feel fairly treated.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_MASGUD_000_117<tab>But do not tarry. Should another come before you, coin in hand, I will not refuse him.
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_CIRINA_000_118<tab>I understand. Thank you for this kindness!
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_CIRINA_000_119<tab>I am sorry, but we must speak of Hien later. I cannot leave Reunion without that kinsai...
TEXT_STMBDA401_02500_SAYTODO_000_000<tab>Mol
